>=
 > I haven' included the zedgraph stuff yet, I'm still not sure about
the
>=
 > performance and memory footprint. BTW do you know if you can set the
> >=
 graphs to roll when the number of data points hits a certain number?
> > T=
his was one of the things I managed to do in RudyGraph by using a
> > circu=
lar buffer based plot set.
>
> My model is sufficiently expensive that the =
impact is negligible.
(BTW,
> I've switched, as recommended, from relaxing =
to a max 5 step
evaluation,
> which has doubled throughput). I don't know a=
bout "rolling" the
graphs,
> I suspect it might be achievable by deleting t=
he earliest point(s)
from
> the PointPairList that drives the display.

Yes=
. There's PointPairList.RemoveAt(index), so setting index =3D 0 will
remove=
 the oldest point. And GraphPane.XAxis.MinAuto =3D true will let the
X axis=
 adjust. A "smooth" rolling action could be acheived by explicitly
setting =
the XAxis.Min/Max properties at each update. Setting the "X"
value on addin=
g to a series to ea.Generation (what I should have done in
the first place)=
 would prevent unwanted behaviour emerging once the
rolling point is reache=
d.

> Mike
